intro: Geonoma paraguanensis, commonly known as the Paraguanan palm, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. This plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized palm, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with long, slender leaflets that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by dark blue, fleshy fruits that are attractive to birds and other wildlife.
